DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the action taken, with respect to a device used in a study, which may or may not be the device under study, as a result of the event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Action Taken with Device
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Describes changes made with respect to the device in the study in response to an event or protocol change.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Describes changes made with respect to the device in the study in response to an event or protocol change.

Concepts.definition: Describes changes made with respect to the device in the study in response to an event or protocol change.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-controlled Terminology. Actions that are related to the device (e.g., Device Removed, Primary Care Physician Notified). See the SDTM Device IG for information on reporting multiple actions, or actions with multiple devices.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What action was taken with a device used in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the action taken resulting from the adverse event that are related to a study or non-study device.
